title: Paul Silverberg
text:
Paul Silverberg (born 6 May 1876 in <a href="Bedburg">Bedburg</a>; died 5 October 1959 in <a href="Lugano">Lugano</a>) was a German industrialist.
Biography.
Paul Silverberg initially worked as a lawyer in the judicial service. In 1903, he became the General Director of Fortuna AG, which later became the Rheinische AG (today ). In 1926 he became part of the company's supervisory board.
In 1934, Silverberg emigrated to Switzerland due to his Jewish origins. Despite <a href="Konrad%20Adenauer">Konrad Adenauer</a>'s requests and being awarded the honorary presidency of the Cologne Chamber of Commerce and Industry, he refused to return to Germany after 1945. Silverberg was a member of <a href="Gustav%20Stresemann">Gustav Stresemann</a>'s national liberal Deutsche Volkspartei.
